CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Mykhaylo Buromenskiy;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant is a disabled war veteran . From DATE he was on a special list of persons to be allocated an apartment by the ORG on priority basis ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in the ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) against ORG , requesting the court to order the defendant to provide him with an apartment on a priority basis .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court dismissed the applicant 's claim .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed and on DATE ORG ( since DATE ORG ) upheld the lower court 's judgment .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG against the ORG , ORG and ORG of GPE , requesting the court to order the defendants to provide him with a apartment on a priority basis and seeking compensation for non - pecuniary damage .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court dismissed the applicant 's claims .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the Court of Appeal ” ) quashed the lower court 's judgment and remitted the case to it for fresh consideration .

CARDINAL . NORP In the course of subsequent hearings before ORG the applicant withdrew some of his claims , eventually requesting the court only to order ORG of GPE to provide him with an apartment on a priority basis .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's claim . On DATE the same court rectified certain clerical errors in its judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE and rendered a new one , ordering ORG of GPE to provide the applicant with an apartment within DATE of the judgment becoming final . Apparently , this judgment was not appealed against .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG instituted proceedings to enforce this judgment .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant requested ORG to change the means of enforcement of the judgment of DATE . In particular he sought replacement of the in - kind award with monetary compensation to him in the amount of CARDINAL NORP hryvnias ( ORG ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court rejected that request , indicating that the matter should be examined by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant 's request in part , ordering ORG of GPE to pay ORG the above - mentioned sum in order to purchase an apartment for the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE this sum was transferred to the bank account of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG terminated the enforcement proceedings against ORG of GPE as the judgment of DATE as amended by the decision of CARDINAL DATE had been enforced .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG authorised the ORG to arrange the purchase of an apartment for the applicant in compliance with the judgment of DATE as amended by the decision of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , the sum awarded on DATE was insufficient to purchase an apartment for the applicant on the secondhand market due to the dramatic increase in real estate prices . For that reason , having invited tenders , on CARDINAL DATE ORG concluded a contract with an appropriate company for the construction of an apartment for the applicant .

CARDINAL . By DATE the apartment at issue had been constructed , and on DATE the ORG issued the applicant with a housing warrant ( ордер на заселення житлової площі ) . On several occasions the applicant was invited to take that warrant but to no avail .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found the applicant to be abusing his rights ( namely , by evading concluding the tenancy contract and , accordingly , paying the tenancy fee ) and ordered him to take the housing warrant and move into the apartment within DATE . In that regard enforcement proceedings were instituted against the applicant but the judgment of DATE has not yet been enforced .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG against the ORG , seeking to annul the defendant 's decision of CARDINAL DATE to issue him with the housing warrant . In particular , he pleaded that the floor space of the apartment allocated to him was less than that guaranteed by the domestic law and that the apartment had been purchased as a result of an unlawful tender . On DATE the court dismissed his claims as unsubstantiated . It is not clear whether the applicant appealed against that decision .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , though , the judgment has still not been enforced . He did not inform the ORG about the events set out in the preceding paragraphs ( CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted administrative proceedings in ORG against ORG , seeking enforcement of the judgment of DATE as amended by the decision of CARDINAL DATE . In view of the increase in real estate prices , the applicant also sought an additional sum of money to be paid by the defendant as compensation for pecuniary damage as a result of the alleged inactivity .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court dismissed the applicant 's claim on account of procedural shortcomings ( in particular , for failure to pay the court fee ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed that decision and remitted the matter of the admissibility of the applicant 's claim to ORG for fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's claim as unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the lower courts ' decisions and discontinued the proceedings , having found that the claim should be examined under the civil procedure .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG to institute criminal proceedings against ORG , alleging embezzlement and misuse of budgetary funds .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor refused to institute criminal proceedings as requested . The applicant appealed against that decision to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision in question and referred the matter back for additional investigation . Subsequently the prosecutor refused to institute the proceedings in question on several occasions and the applicant successfully challenged those refusals before ORG .
CARDINAL . Apparently the investigation is still pending .
CARDINAL . Under LAW of the DATE LAW publicly owned dwellings shall be used on the basis of a tenancy contract concluded between the tenant and the relevant authority .

CARDINAL . The Military Servicemen Legal and Social Protection Act ( no . CARDINAL of DATE , as amended at the material time ) sets forth that the ORG provides the military servicemen with , among other benefits , appropriate dwelling ( section CARDINAL ) . Those servicemen who have retired due to their service - related injuries and diseases are entitled to housing on a priority basis ( section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Under section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of ORG ( no . CARDINAL of DATE , as amended at the material time ) the dwelling occupied by the military servicemen who enjoy benefits under the above Military Servicemen Legal and Social Protection Act shall be granted free of charge into private property of these military servicemen .

CARDINAL . NORP The Veterans of War and Their Social Protection Guarantees Act ( no . TIME of DATE , as amended at the material time ) guarantees that disabled war veterans shall be housed within DATE , at maximum , of submitting an appropriate application , provided that their existing accommodation does not comply with the relevant housing standards ( section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . ORG ( no . CARDINAL-IV , valid since DATE ) provides the same guarantees to the veterans of war ( sections CARDINAL and DATE ) . Under section CARDINAL § CARDINAL , however , social dwellings are not subject to privatisation .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is summarised in the judgment of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .

CARDINAL . Under LAW of LAW the bailiff and the parties to the enforcement proceedings ( debtor and creditor ) are entitled to request proprio motu the relevant court to change the means of enforcement of a court decision if there are circumstances which preclude its enforcement by the means specified in that decision .
